name: Pareira brava
Relationship: Compare: PARIETARIA (renal calculi; nightmare, patient dreaming of being buried alive); CHIMAPHILA (chronic catarrhal congestion following cystitis; acute prostatitis; feeling of a ball in perineum when sitting); FABIANA, see PICHI (dysuria; post-gonorrhoeal complications; gravel; vesical catarrh); UVA.; HYDRANG.; BERBER.; OCIM.; HEDEOM.

Urine: Inflammation of urethra; becomes almost cartilaginous
Constant urging; great straining; pain down thighs during efforts to urinate
Feeling of the bladder being distended and neuralgic pain in the anterior crural region
Itching along urethra; urethritis, with prostatic trouble
Can emit urine only when he goes on his knees, pressing head firmly against the floor

details: The urinary symptoms are most important. Useful in renal colic, prostatic affections, and catarrh of bladder. Sensation as if bladder were distended, with pain. PAIN GOING DOWN THIGH.
